clinical_study.brief_title: Coronary Bifurcation Lesions Treated With Biguard Stent System
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multi-center, Randomized Trial Comparing Biguard Stent With Regular Sirolimus-eluting Stent System for Patients With Coronary Bifurcation Lesions

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to test the hypothesis that the Biguard stent system will lead to fewer target lesion failure compared to regular stent system in patients with coronary bifurcation lesions at one year.

detailed_description.textblock: The current study is designed as a multicenter, randomized and prospective study aiming to compare the effect of Biguard bifurcation stent system and regular stent system in patients with bifurcation lesions. Based on the previous studies, the rate of 1-year target lesion failure was around 12% after PCI with regular stent system. And the investigators previous data showed that this event at 12-month after Biguard bifurcation stent system was 4%. Considering the lost to follow-up, it is anticipated that up to 400 patients will be enrolled in the trial. All patients will have repeat angiography at 13 months, with clinical follow-up to 2 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Ischemia Driven Target Lesion Failure (ID-TLF)
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with adverse events that are related to treatment. Adverse events included cardiac death (death in which a cardiac cause cannot be excluded), Myocardial infarction (MI, classified as Q-wave and non-Q wave), Ischemia-driven target lesion revascularization (TLR) by CABG or PCI and Ischemia-driven target vessel revascularization (TVR) by CABG or PCI.

secondary_outcome.measure: In-stent late lumen loss in millimeter
secondary_outcome.description: In-stent MLD post-procedure minus in-stent MLD at follow-up (in-stent defined as within the margins of the stent)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proximal Late Loss in millimeter
secondary_outcome.description: Proximal Minimum Lumen Diameter (MLD) post-procedure minus proximal MLD at follow-up (proximal defined as within 5 mm of healthy tissue proximal to stent placement)

secondary_outcome.measure: Distal Late Loss in millimeter
secondary_outcome.description: Distal MLD post-procedure minus distal MLD at follow-up (distal defined as within 5 mm of healthy tissue distal to stent placement)
